intro: Dipteracanthus nitens, commonly known as the white-flowered dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and moths, contributing to its ecological significance.
